definition: in a spurt of energy
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He sailed in and finished the job.
sentences.chinese: 他一鼓作氣完成了任務。

sentences.english: But the players buckled down and we went on to win the league.
sentences.chinese: 但球員們一鼓作氣拿下了聯賽冠軍。

sentences.english: She kept her head straight and ran towards Mrs. Douala’s class.
sentences.chinese: 她一鼓作氣，一直跑到了阿杜拉夫人的班上。

sentences.english: I memorized 50 new words at one fling today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我一鼓作氣背了50個單詞。

sentences.english: Tae Kwon Do makes me aggressive in reaching my goals with focus and integrity.
sentences.chinese: 跆拳道培養了我的毅力來一鼓作氣地達到我的目標。

sentences.english: Then a drum annoy to create soft and charming body Zi.
sentences.chinese: 然後一鼓作氣打造曼妙身姿。

sentences.english: They pressed on without letup until they got to the top of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他們一鼓作氣爬上山頂。

definition: the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to just escape from calamity
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
red in the face/extremely angry
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to force someone to do something
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
to make a long story short (idiom)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
smell of gunpowder/(fig.) combative tone/belligerence
